Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower with added red centre and added white outline above two white bands; exterior: narrow black band at top of rim; band of single dots around rim; below, painted decoration, head of woman or sphinx, to left.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the figure on the sherd may be a worshipper. If the figure is a female worshipper, then the sherd ought to belong to the Group of Worshippers. The leading vase from this group is the St. Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos 1991, no. 964). Most of the vases in this group display a mixture of techniques consisting of portraying female figures in outline and dancing komasts in black figure.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 51, pl. V, no. 38)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 100, p. 126, p. 128, p. 287, no. 835, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1065) (phase 2)
